plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are hardy perennials often called 'mums,' popular in gardens and floral arrangements. They have bushy, flowering stems and come in many vibrant colors, symbolizing autumn in many cultures.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide (Asia, Europe, North America)
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums were first cultivated in China over 3,000 years ago and are considered a symbol of longevity and rejuvenation.

plants.name: Rhododendron arboreum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree known for its spectacular clusters of bright flowers. It thrives in mountainous regions and is the national flower of Nepal.
plants.funFact: The tree rhododendron can grow up to 20 meters tall and is an important nectar source for honey bees in its native habitat.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen tree native to eastern Australia, valued for both its ornamental orange flowers and timber.
plants.location: Subtropical to tropical regions, Australia and cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not an oak; its name comes from the silky texture of the wood and oak-like leaves.

plants.name: Clerodendrum paniculatum
plants.description: Tropical shrub with large, showy clusters shaped like a pagoda, attracting butterflies and hummingbirds.
plants.funFact: The pagoda flower is often planted in temple gardens across Southeast Asia due to its striking architectural flower arrangement.
